messages: d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (06:55): hi guys & girls
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (06:57): how are you today ?

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:58): so, regarding http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=7546#c10, "HTML 5 being superseded by CCN or a similar structural change", anybody know what "CCN" is?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:59): d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad: I am doing swimingly
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:00): i am looking for someone who can design a site for me :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:00): content-centric networking
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:01): d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad: I think this would probably not be the best place to look
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:01): there are not so many designers here
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:01): any suggestions ?
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:02): i do not know web building
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:02): d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad: how much would you be able to pay somebody to design the site?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:22): it seems that CCNx is the more common abbreviation for content-centric networking these days
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:24): yeah
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:24): depends on what they ask
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:24): i am fair guy
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:24): and what they can offer
d36632a49b3f4755448b758ae048bfad (07:24): just NO Flash
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:33): what is CCN?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:33): as in, what does "content centric networking" actually mean
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:35): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: yeah, though not clear how it'd ever "supersede" HTML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:35): whether it would or not, I am now curious what it means
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:35): I seriously have no idea
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:35): it is not a term I have heard before
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (07:36): guesses it's the supposedly next term after DHTML, AJAX, HTML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:38): from googling, it sounds considerably lower level than HTML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:38): sounds like it is more a replacement for TCP/IP
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:39): yeah
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:39): (though I am still not sure what it is exactly)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:41): Hixie: I would like to bring http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9178 to your attention
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:41): request for Noah/TAG : add definition of "conforming document"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:42): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=7034 is one I raised but I'm not quite sure where we're at with it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:43): it really seems like a meta-issue, not a request for a specific change to the spec
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: where I'd like to be at with it is one or more bugs that propose specific changes to conformance requirements
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I don't like having this open-ended bug where everyone commenting has a different idea of what it means
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:44): yeah
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:44): "remove all document conformance requirememts
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:44): " would be a very clear bug
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:44): but if this bug ever represented that request, then Sam has apparently repurposed it for something different
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:45): Larry also made yet another different request
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:46): and there's all the old history
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:46): what that bug started out as was 'change "conformance checker" to "ideology checker" or "loyalty checker"'
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:46): yeah, which was kind of a joke
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:46): then at least some people supported removing all document conformance requirements as a serious idea
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:47): If I were to close it myself at this point, I guess somebody else would likely just re-open it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:47): now Sam seems to be proposing some set of adding requirements, removing requirements, and making requirements optional

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:48): if you feel Sam's request differs from yours, you could work with him to put it in one or more other bugs, or you could go ahead and let him repurpose the bug
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:48): the biggest thing I'd worry about is if multiple people try to repurpose the bug, all for different purposes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:54): I would prefer to remove myself as the reporter of that bug, but I guess there's no way to do actually do that
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:55): not without hacking the database

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:56): btw it looks like moving all those bugs to VERIFIED has been successful at getting issues to move to either CLOSED or REOPENED instead of languishing at RESOLVED
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:56): which makes me happy
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:57): we're up to 325 CLOSED, where yesterday I think we were around 270
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:58): I just closed all of the ones I had reported
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (07:59): except for two
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (07:59): I did all of mine except one
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:00): we still have a backlog of 1278 bugs in RESOLVED or VERIFIED
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:01): of which 34 are marked with TrackerIssue or TrackerRequest
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:01): so there's clearly a big backlog of bugs that haven't gotten a reply from the originator
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:01): thanks for doing your part to reduce that number
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (08:09): I actually didn't do all mine.. the two I have not closed yet are 7034 (the one we were just discussing) and 9178 (add definition of "conforming document")
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:16): http://img710.imageshack.us/img710/2292/smurfperception.png
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (08:20): opps, meant that for the ot
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (08:26): 9178 is still NEW, so that's not an issue
